de.mrapp.android.adapter

Interface MultipleChoiceListAdapter<DataType>

  • Type Parameters:
    DataType - The type of the adapter's underlying data
    All Superinterfaces:
    android.widget.Adapter, java.lang.Cloneable, DataStructure, EnableStateListAdapter<DataType>, FilterableListAdapter<DataType>, ItemStateListAdapter<DataType>, android.widget.ListAdapter, Loggable, Parameterizable, RecyclerViewAdapter, Restorable, SelectableListAdapter<DataType>, java.io.Serializable, SortableListAdapter<DataType>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    MultipleChoiceListAdapterImplementation

    public interface MultipleChoiceListAdapter<DataType>
extends SelectableListAdapter<DataType>
    Defines the interface, an adapter, whose underlying data is managed as a list of arbitrary items, of which multiple items can be selected at once, must implement. Such an adapter's purpose is to provide the underlying data for visualization using a AbsListView widget.
    Since:
    0.1.0

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface android.widget.Adapter

        IGNORE_ITEM_VIEW_TYPE, NO_SELECTION

      • setSelected

        boolean setSelected(int index,
                    boolean selected)
        Sets the selection of the item, which belongs to a specific index, if it is currently enabled.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the item, whose selection should be set, as an Integer value. The index must be between 0 and the value of the method getCount():int - 1, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        selected - True, if the item, which belongs to the given index, should be selected, false otherwise
        Returns:
        True, if the selection of the item, which belongs to the given index, has been changed, false otherwise

      • setSelected

        boolean setSelected(@NonNull
                    DataType item,
                    boolean selected)
        Sets the selection of a specific item, if it is currently enabled.
        Parameters:
        item - The item, whose selection should be set, as an instance of the generic type DataType. The item may not be null. If the item does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        selected - True, if the given item should be selected, false otherwise
        Returns:
        True, if the selection of the given item has been changed, false otherwise

      • triggerSelection

        boolean triggerSelection(int index)
        Triggers the selection of the item, which belongs to a specific index, it is currently enabled. This causes the item to become unselected, if it is currently selected and vice versa.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the item, whose selection should be triggered, as an Integer value. The index must be between 0 and the value of the method getCount():int - 1, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        Returns:
        True, if the selection of the item, which belongs to the given index, has been changed, false otherwise

      • triggerSelection

        boolean triggerSelection(@NonNull
                         DataType item)
        Triggers the selection of a specific item, it it is currently enabled. This causes the item to become unselected, if it is currently selected and vice versa.
        Parameters:
        item - The item, whose selection should be triggered, as an instance of the generic type DataType. The item may not be null. If the item does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        Returns:
        True, if the selection of the given item has been changed, false otherwise

      • setAllSelected

        boolean setAllSelected(boolean selected)
        Sets the selection of all items, if they are currently enabled.
        Parameters:
        selected - True, if all items should be selected, false otherwise
        Returns:
        True, if the selections of all items have been changed, false otherwise

      • triggerAllSelections

        boolean triggerAllSelections()
        Triggers the selections of all items, if they are currently enabled. This causes an item to become unselected, if it is currently selected and vice versa.
        Returns:
        True, if the selections of all items have been changed, false otherwise
